content: What famous American landmark was a gift from France to commemorate the centennial of the United States' independence?

Ah, I think I know this one! It's the Statue of Liberty, right? France gave it to the United States to celebrate 100 years of independence. It's a really iconic symbol of freedom and democracy. I remember learning about it in school. The statue was dedicated in 1886 and it's located on Liberty Island in New York Harbor. It's amazing how it has become such an important part of American culture and history.
